snippet: A former Conservative Party official says his name was falsely made public in an inquiry into child sexual abuse involving Jimmy Savile, the host of BBC programs from the 1970s to the 1990s.
abstract: Alistair McAlpine, former official of Britain's Conservative Party, says his name was falsely made public in an inquiry into child sexual abuse involving former BBC host Jimmy Savile; McAlpine pledges to take legal action to clear his name.
lead_paragraph: A former Conservative Party official says his name was falsely made public in an inquiry into child sexual abuse involving Jimmy Savile, the host of BBC programs from the 1970s to the 1990s.

headline.seo: Ex-Official Threatens Suit in Pedophile Scandal
headline.main: Ex-Official Threatens Suit in British Pedophile Case
headline.print_headline: Ex-Official Threatens Suit In British Pedophile Case
